page.title: 17TUG-O-WAR BONAR BRIDGE.
page.content: In 1976 a few men thought that it was time to start a{local tug-o-war team. They asked friends if they would take part. So they started training .They attached heavy weights on to a pulley and attached the rope they pull on to that .They train 2 nights a week. On August, 8th. 1976, they competed in the{Golspie Gala Week}and won. They called the team{the Bonar Bridge {Caledonion.}After a few years they became famous all over Scotland. During 1983-84 they won the{104 {stone Scottish Championships.}They pay their expenses with the money they raise at sales of work and their prize money . At Christmas they give presents to the old age pensioners. There is another team called{Swordale. In the years to come they hope to have many more trophies .
